trustfund: BBMPT-BB MONTREAL PROTOCOL,TF022004-OTF-JORDAN ODS PHASEOUT PROJECT II

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Phase of the
            Ozone-Depleting Substances Project for Jordan were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory; risk to global
            environment outcome was negligible or low; Bank performance
            was satisfactory and borrower performance was also
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: World Bank
            Montreal Protocol (MP) operations has followed the phased
            reductions of various groups of Ozone Depleting Substances
            (ODS) per the MP and in accordance with Multilateral Fund
            for the Implementation of the MP (MLF) policy and as such
            required an extensive period of time to eliminate relevant
            ODS while putting into place institutional arrangements and
            regulatory measures to control and monitor ODS use and
            elimination in relevant sectors. Active national involvement
            at the related international forums proved an important
            success factor. The special features of MP operations, which
            work with specific industries while contributing to global
            environmental benefits, often strand MP projects without a
            clear sectoral home and commensurate management priority.
            Given the very specialized skills needed for this type of
            operation, it is necessary to cultivate appropriate national
            and/or regional consultant skills for repeated use. The
            safeguards review process for the World Bank Group is
            expected to will align Bank safeguard policies with
            International Finance Corporation (IFC) performance
            standards, which will subsequently strengthen Bank Group
            safeguards design and supervision with respect to worker
            health and safety as well as working with private industries
            as beneficiaries.
